para.dtcname: Rough Idling or Excessive Engine Vibrations

item.ptxt: Rough idling or juddering due to abnormal combustion
Juddering when vehicle is starting due to clutch system malfunctions
Injector sliding malfunction
Injector stuck closed
Injector stuck open
Deposits in injector
Injector circuit malfunction
Clutch system (juddering when starting)
Injector compensation code
Fuel leak
Engine mounting
Intake system leakage
Intake system blockage
Throttle valve system
Mass air flow meter
Fuel supply pump assembly (suction control valve)
Fuel pressure sensor
Low quality fuel
Vehicle modifications
Fuel filter element assembly air bleed problem
Accessory problem (A/C, generator, etc.)
ECM
This troubleshooting procedure checks for the cause of rough idling and excessive engine vibrations.

Specified values in the following troubleshooting flowchart are for reference only. Variations in the Data List result values may occur depending on the measuring conditions or the vehicle's age. Do not judge the vehicle to be normal even when the Data List values indicate a standard level. There are possibly some concealed factors causing the malfunction.
Check that the vehicle has not been modified in any way prior to the vehicle inspection.

step1.ptxt: Faults and Symptoms of Common Rail Diesel Components

entry.ptxt: Decrease in performance (foreign matter is stuck)

atten4.ptxt: The maximum fuel injection volume is controlled according to the output from the mass air flow meter.

entry.ptxt: Difficult to start, rough idle, knocking, white smoke (when cold)

item.ptxt: Measure the resistance of the glow plug
Check the glow plug indicator light
When cranking during the "Check the Cylinder Compression" Active Test, if there is a high speed cylinder, approx. 100 rpm more than the other cylinders, that cylinder may lose compression.
When an Injector Feedback Val is more than 3 mm3/st, there may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder.

entry.ptxt: Difficult to start, engine stalling, rough idle, lack of power
Fuel Press, Target Common Rail Pressure, Target Pump SCV Current

item.ptxt: Fuel Press is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure during idling with the engine warmed up (the engine coolant temperature is higher than 75°C (167°F)).
If the fuel pressure is 20000 kPa below the target pressure, then a lack of power will be felt.
If the fuel pressure is below 25000 kPa, then idling will be rough.
The fuel pressure changes at engine start, but is approx. 25000 kPa at engine start after the engine is warmed up.
When Target Pump SCV Current is 3000 mA or higher, the suction control valve has a tendency to become stuck.

entry.ptxt: Even if Fuel Press is below Target Common Rail Pressure, a DTC will not be stored.
Difficult to start, engine stalling, rough idle, lack of power
Fuel Press, Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Fuel Press is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure during idling with the engine warmed up (the engine coolant temperature is higher than 75°C (167°F)).
If the fuel pressure is 20000 kPa below the target pressure, then a lack of power will be felt.
If the fuel pressure is below 25000 kPa, then idling will be rough.

atten4.ptxt: The fuel pressure changes at engine start, but is approx. 25000 kPa at engine start after the engine is warmed up.

entry.ptxt: Even if Fuel Press is below Target Common Rail Pressure, a DTC will not be stored.
Rough idle, lack of power, black smoke, white smoke, knocking

item.ptxt: When an Injector Feedback Val is more than 3 mm3/st, there may be a malfunction in the corresponding cylinder. This value can be read after idling for 1 minute.

entry.ptxt: Circuit fault: The fuel fuel injector does not open.
Difficult to start, rough idle, lack of power, black smoke, white smoke, knocking
When the injector driver has a fault, some DTCs may be stored.
Open circuit, decrease in performance (foreign matter is stuck)
Difficult to start, rough idle, engine stall, lack of power
Fuel Press, Target Common Rail Pressure

item.ptxt: Slowly raise the engine speed from idling to 3000 rpm with the vehicle stopped and check that Fuel Press follows Target Common Rail Pressure. If the fuel pressure sensor malfunctions, the actual fuel pressure may deviate from the target fuel pressure (either Fuel Press decreases to a value less than Target Common Rail Pressure).

entry.ptxt: When the fuel pressure sensor has a fault, some DTCs may be stored.
Difficult to start, rough idle (especially when cold)

item.ptxt: Stuck closed: Lack of power, difficult to start, rough idle, engine stall, black smoke. These may occur when stuck almost fully closed.
Stuck open: Turbocharger sound increases. When the engine is stopped, engine vibrations may occur.

entry.ptxt: Actual Throttle Position, Actual Throttle Position #2

item.ptxt: 100%: Fully closed
0%: Fully open

When the ignition switch is turned to ON (the engine is stopped), the diesel throttle is fully open. When idling, the diesel throttle is at the halfway point. When the ignition switch is turned from ON to off, the throttle is fully closed temporarily.

step1.ptxt: Data List Related to Rough Idling

item.ptxt: Engine Speed
MAF
Intake Air
Coolant Temp
Engine Speed of Cyl #1 (to #8)
(Output only when the "Check the Cylinder Compression" Active Test is performed)
Target Common Rail Pressure
Fuel Press
Target Pump SCV Current
Injection Feedback Val #1 (to #8)
Injection Volume
Actual Throttle Position
Actual Throttle Position #2
After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (See page ) and initialization (See page ).
After replacing the fuel supply pump assembly, the ECM needs initialization.
Click here
After replacing an fuel injector, the ECM needs registration.
Click here

test1.ptxt: Identify when shuddering occurs.

entry.ptxt: When engaging engine clutch at vehicle start

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK WIRE HARNESS AND CONNECTION IN ENGINE COMPARTMENT

test1.ptxt: Check the wire harness and connector connections of common rail system components.

specitem.ptxt: The wire harnesses and connectors are connected securely.

atten4.ptxt: The engine may have problems when there is an intermittent disconnection in a circuit related to the fuel pressure sensor, crankshaft position sensor, engine coolant temperature sensor, etc.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the pending DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

atten4.ptxt: If only DTC P1605 is output, proceed to step 4.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Warm up the engine (engine coolant temperature is 75°C (167°F) or higher).
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Diesel Rough Idle.
Take a snapshot when idling with no load after the engine is warmed up and when the problem is occurring.

item.ptxt: A snapshot can be used to compare vehicle data from the time of the malfunction to normal data and is very useful for troubleshooting.
The shift lever should be in neutral and the A/C switch and all accessory switches should be off.
If rough idling occurs when the A/C switch is on, take another snapshot with the A/C switch on.
Take a snapshot when the problem is occurring, such as when the engine is cold. However, if the problem does not reoccur, it is acceptable to only take a snapshot after the engine is warmed up.

test1.ptxt: Start the engine.
Fully depress the accelerator pedal, and then release it.
Check whether white smoke is emitted when racing the engine.

atten3.ptxt: Be sure not to check for white smoke indoors.

atten4.ptxt: Depending on whether there is oil mixed with the fuel, or whether there is unburned fuel present, the smell of the exhaust gas differs. When oil is mixed in, the exhaust gas smells such as burning oil.

test1.ptxt: Check the engine speed in the snapshot taken in procedure 4 when the engine was idling.

entry.ptxt: Change in engine speed coincides with air conditioning system operation

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK DATA LIST (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8 AND INJECTION VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Check Injection Feedback Val # in the snapshot taken in procedure 4 when the engine was idling.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is more than +3 mm3/st and engine vibration is abnormally large

item.ptxt: When there is a problem with the operation of an fuel injector due to foreign matter in the inside of the fuel injector, etc., the fuel injection volume decreases. As a result, the ECM gives instructions to increase the fuel injection volume, which causes Injection Feedback Val to increase.

The ECM controls the system so that the sum of Injection Feedback Val for all of the cylinders is approximately 0 mm3/st. Even if the value of Injection Feedback Val for a cylinder is less than -3.0 mm3/st, as long as the value of Injection Feedback Val for each of the other cylinders is 3.0 mm3/st or less, the fuel injectors are not malfunctioning.

test1.ptxt: Read the injector compensation code.
Click here

specitem.ptxt: Compensation codes stored in the ECM match compensation codes of the installed injector assemblies.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (CONTROL THE SELECT CYLINDER FUEL CUT)

atten4.ptxt: Use this Active Test to determine the malfunctioning cylinder.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut.

item.ptxt: If the engine idle speed does not change when an fuel injector is disabled, the cylinder being tested is malfunctioning.
If the cylinder being tested is normal, there will be a significant change in idle speed when the fuel injection is stopped for that cylinder.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

app-param-unit.app-param: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTOR OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector of the malfunctioning cylinder.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: CLEAN FUEL FILTER CASE AND REPLACE FUEL FILTER ELEMENT ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Clean the fuel filter case and replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to clean the inside of the fuel filter case as the injector assemblies may not operate properly if the fuel filter element assembly is installed with foreign matter remaining inside the fuel filter case.

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Register the injector compensation code.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK DATA LIST (FUEL PRESS AND TARGET COMMON RAIL PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Check the engine speed in the snapshot taken in procedure 4 when the engine was idling after having been warmed up.

entry.ptxt: Difference between Fuel Press and Target Common Rail Pressure is 5000 kPa (51.0 kgf/cm2, 725 psi) or more

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Target Common Rail Pressure and Fuel Press.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: With no load after the engine is warmed up, take a snapshot when idling and vehicle was accelerating with the accelerator pedal fully depressed in 2nd gear.
Check the Target Common Rail Pressure and Fuel Press.

entry.ptxt: While idling the vehicle, "Fuel Press" deviates from the normal range and varies periodically with a period of approximately 2 seconds or more*1
"Fuel Press" is normal while idling the vehicle, but "Fuel Press" does not follow "Target Common Rail Pressure" when the accelerator pedal is fully depressed in 2nd gear*2

item.ptxt: *1: The cause may be a squashed or blocked fuel pipe or hose.
*2: The cause may be a clogged fuel filter.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE CLOGGED FUEL LINE

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the clogged (including frozen fuel) fuel pipe.
Replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: If "Fuel Press" does not follow "Target Common Rail Pressure" when the accelerator pedal is fully depressed in 2nd gear, replace the fuel filter element assembly.

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Check the air conditioning system.

item.ptxt: Be sure to check the air conditioning hoses and pipes.
Check the refrigerant pressure.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel supply pump assembly.
Click here
Perform fuel supply pump initialization.
Click here
Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS AND CONNECTOR

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the harness or connector.
Check the following items and repair the malfunctioning part if necessary.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ROUGH IDLING OR EXCESSIVE ENGINE VIBRATIONS

test1.ptxt: Check rough idling or excessive engine vibrations.

entry.ptxt: Rough idling or excessive engine vibrations do not occur

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK AND REPLACE ENGINE MOUNTING INSULATOR

test1.ptxt: Check the following items and repair or replace the malfunctioning part if necessary.

test2.ptxt: Check that the engine mounting insulators are installed correctly.
Check that the engine mounting insulators are not twisted.
Check that deformation of an engine mounting insulator is not causing the engine to contact the vehicle body.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED
